Scolari: Ronaldo has asked about China

Real Madrid superstar Cristiano Ronaldo has asked about the Chinese Super League amid talk of a lucrative move, claims Luiz Felipe Scolari.

Scolari, who has worked with the Portugal national side and in China with Guangzhou Evergrande, told Esporte Interativo at the Quina Awards in Lisbon: "He has asked me more than once what life in China is like. Why is it that Ronaldo cannot go to China?"

Ronaldo made a bet with teammates that he would overturn Messi's Pichichi lead

Barcelona's incredible start to the season was characterised by Lionel Messi's blistering goalscoring, however when the disparity between the two players was 11 goals, Cristiano Ronaldo made a bet with his teammates that he would win the Pichichi award.

Arsenal announce double charity match against Real Madrid

Arsenal have announced two charity matches against Real Madrid, following the success of the legends match against AC Milan Glorie in 2016.

On Monday, Arsenal revealed the two matches on the club website. The first will take place at the Santiago Bernabeu on Sunday, June 3rd. Then they’ll return to London for a second meeting on Saturday, September 8th.

Robert Pires, Freddie Ljungberg, Gilberto Silva, Ray Parlour, Sol Campbell, Lauren and Tomas Rosicky are all on the list of players taking part from Arsenal. On the other side, Roberto Carlos, Xabi Alonso and Raul will play for Real Madrid.

VAZQUEZ HAPPY AT MADRID

Reported Arsenal and Liverpool target Lucas Vazquez has revealed his happiness with life at Real Madrid.

The Spain international, who has been linked with Arsenal and Liverpool, has been a key player for Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane in recent weeks and admits he is delighted with life at the Bernabeu.

Speaking to Spanish radio show El Transistor, Vazquez said: “I am very happy at Real Madrid, it’s the team that formed me as a player and I hope that I can be here for many years. I think that I am in the sweetest moment, with the most confidence, since I arrived at Madrid, contributing to the team and getting good results.”

Zidane gives Lewandowski consent for Real Madrid move

Madrid has not yet made contact with the German club, who it should be noted do not want to let their top scorer leave, however it is believed that a price close to 100 million euros could open the doors.

This value could be made up with Madrid forgoing the 42 million to be paid by the German club next summer to keep James Rodriguez, currently on loan.


https://en.as.com/en/2018/03/21/football/1521618710_312387.html

Rodriguez was offloaded by Real Madrid in the summer, with the Colombia international signing a two-year loan deal at Bayern Munich.

The player is currently in fine fettle over in Bavaria, shining under the tutelage of Jump Heynckes and helping Bayern cruise towards an inevitable Bundesliga title.

However, despite that, talk has been rife of a Real return with Los Blancos’ current attacking players struggling for form.

And Spanish website Don Balon claim Rodriguez thinks his best chance of returning to the Bernabeu would be if Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho was to return.

Mourinho ruled the roost for three years earlier in his career, between 2010 and 2013.

replies.msg:
ASENSIO BACKS ZIDANE

Real Madrid midfielder Marco Asensio believes Zinedine Zidane should continue as the club’s manager.

Zidane, who guided Madrid to back-to-back Champions League titles in 2016 and 2017, has faced speculation over his future in recent months due to the Spanish capital club’s mixed domestic performances.

However, Asensio has backed the Frenchman to stay on in his role.

Speaking to Spanish radio show El Larguero, he said: "I think he has to continue, he has solved everything very well.

“He has shown [that] winning the league and Champions League. I think that the demand is very high and they forget things very quickly. I think he is the ideal manager."

CEBALLOS TO MILAN?

AC Milan are interested in a summer move for Real Madrid midfielder Dani Ceballos, according to sources in Italy.

The Spaniard joined Madrid in a €16.5m deal from Real Betis last summer but has only made nine appearances for the Bernabeu giants this season.

Milan are keen on the playmaker and the player may be open to a move if it would boost his chances of securing regular first-team football.

It is believed Milan could offer around €40m for the former Betis man.
